1.text: Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity Than he that is perverse in his lips and is a fool.

2.text: Also, that the soul be without knowledge is not good; And he that hasteth with his feet sinneth.

3.text: The foolishness of man subverteth his way; And his heart fretteth against Jehovah.

4.text: Wealth addeth many friends; But the poor is separated from his friend.

5.text: A false witness shall not be unpunished; And he that uttereth lies shall not escape.

6.text: Many will entreat the favor of the liberal man; And every man is a friend to him that giveth gifts.

7.text: All the brethren of the poor do hate him: How much more do his friends go far from him! He pursueth them with words, but they are gone.

8.text: He that getteth wisdom loveth his own soul: He that keepeth understanding shall find good.

9.text: A false witness shall not be unpunished; And he that uttereth lies shall perish.

10.text: Delicate living is not seemly for a fool; Much less for a servant to have rule over princes.

11.text: The discretion of a man maketh him slow to anger; And it is his glory to pass over a transgression.

12.text: The king’s wrath is as the roaring of a lion; But his favor is as dew upon the grass.

13.text: A foolish son is the calamity of his father; And the contentions of a wife are a continual dropping.

14.text: House and riches are an inheritance from fathers; But a prudent wife is from Jehovah.

15.text: Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep; And the idle soul shall suffer hunger.

16.text: He that keepeth the commandment keepeth his soul; But he that is careless of his ways shall die.

17.text: He that hath pity upon the poor lendeth unto Jehovah, And his good deed will he pay him again.

18.text: Chasten thy son, seeing there is hope; And set not thy heart on his destruction.

19.text: A man of great wrath shall bear the penalty; For if thou deliver him, thou must do it yet again.

20.text: Hear counsel, and receive instruction, That thou mayest be wise in thy latter end.

21.text: There are many devices in a man’s heart; But the counsel of Jehovah, that shall stand.

22.text: That which maketh a man to be desired is his kindness; And a poor man is better than a liar.

23.text: The fear of Jehovah tendeth to life; And he that hath it shall abide satisfied; He shall not be visited with evil.

24.text: The sluggard burieth his hand in the dish, And will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.

25.text: Smite a scoffer, and the simple will learn prudence; And reprove one that hath understanding, and he will understand knowledge.

26.text: He that doeth violence to his father, and chaseth away his mother, Is a son that causeth shame and bringeth reproach.

27.text: Cease, my son, to hear instruction Only to err from the words of knowledge.

28.text: A worthless witness mocketh at justice; And the mouth of the wicked swalloweth iniquity.

29.text: Judgments are prepared for scoffers, And stripes for the back of fools.
